body_html: @ngimel I installed pytorch using nvidia-docker and ran a basic script that used DataParallel. The script still hangs at the same point. Looking at nvidia-smi outside the docker shows both GPUs at 100% utilization, so it looks like the same symptoms as before.
body_text: @ngimel I installed pytorch using nvidia-docker and ran a basic script that used DataParallel. The script still hangs at the same point. Looking at nvidia-smi outside the docker shows both GPUs at 100% utilization, so it looks like the same symptoms as before.
body: @ngimel I installed pytorch using nvidia-docker and ran a [basic script that used DataParallel](https://gist.github.com/zou3519/f13145cafbb873a855ef524d6607125a). The script still hangs at the same point. Looking at nvidia-smi outside the docker shows both GPUs at 100% utilization, so it looks like the same symptoms as before.
